results.title: The Television newsman
results.brief_description: Follows a working day in the life of television newsman Bill Redeker, showing how a new kind of filmmaking has developed which combines news analysis with actual sights and sounds of an event.

results.title: The Television age in Japan
results.brief_description: Shows how television has become an inseparable part of life in many areas of Japan. A survey of the whole television industry is made - from its use for educational purposes to pure entertainment, production in studios for live telecast and production for film.

results.title: The Telephone. La Voix humaine
results.creator_credit: Mike Newman, Paul Meyer, BBC-TV and Decca
results.brief_description: Menotti’s “The Telephone”, appropriately subtitled “L’amour a trois”, is a simple story. Ben unsuccessfully tries to declare his love for Lucy, but is constantly thwarted by the ringing telephone. It is to the telephone, surely the third person of the triangle, that he has to finally resort, in order to convey his message. In “La Voix humaine”, music by Poulenc, text by Cocteau, a woman bids goodbye to her long-time lover prey to wrong numbers, party lines and cuttings off. What should be a highly charged emotional scene is dehumanised, where the normal physical bond of the moment is replaced by the unpredictable link of the telephone wires. Performed by the Scottish Chamber Orchestra.

results.title: The Telephone
results.creator_credit: David Cons, Denis Ward and Technical and Scientific Films
results.brief_description: An elementary description of the emission and use of sound waves for distant communication, and the early telephone invented by Alexander Graham Bell. The progress of modern telephones and speech amplification are also included in this film.

results.title: The Teeth - development and care
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description: This film deals with the care of the teeth, based on a knowledge of what teeth are, how they are formed, and the factors which effect their growth, formation, and preservation.

results.title: The Technique of artificial pneumothorax
results.brief_description: Apparatus used in the operation of applying artificial pneumothorax treatment in pulmonary tuberculosis (controlled collapse of the infected lung). Shows the induction in the lung wall; the refill in the lung wall; explains the treatment necessary to effect a complete cure.

results.title: The Teaching box
results.creator_credit: Stephen Ocko and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description: Describes the establishment of a revolutionary experiment in education which has been successfully launched in American Samoa - a group of six small islands. Seeking an expansion of their educational system, Samoans turned to closed circuit television for a solution. High quality education on both primary and secondary school levels is now transmitted daily throughout the islands.

results.title: The Teacher: authority or automaton?
results.creator_credit: Mort Ransen, Richard Gilbert and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: In our overflowing classrooms, are methods of mass production edging out traditional ways of education? This film offers a vocal sampling of opinion from across Canada. Teachers, administrators and high-ranking educators speak their minds freely about the problems facing education in Canada today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mort Ransen, Richard Gilbert and ONF | NFB

results.title: The Teacher and Technology (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Use of audiovisual equipment in the classroom. The technical sophistication is not as important as the usage and the input. Stresses need for careful selection of media to suit specific learning experience and students involved
